item.title: Suspect in robbery of rapper Macklemore’s home arrested, police say
item.description: Police in Washington state have arrested a man suspected of robbing Macklemore’s house earlier this summer.

item.title: US Postal Service employee helped steal checks in mail, sold mailbox key to others
item.description: An employee with the United State Postal Service admitted Thursday to stealing checks from the mail and selling the key to co-conspirators to steal mail.

item.title: Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy again but vows to keep flying
item.description: Budget carrier Spirit Airlines said Friday that it has filed for fresh bankruptcy protection.

item.title: Costco’s new shopping policy officially starts Monday
item.description: Costco says a grace period is ending and the policy will take effect on Labor Day.

item.title: Numbers drawn for estimated $1 billion Powerball jackpot
item.description: The numbers have been selected for an estimated $1 billion Powerball jackpot.

item.title: Bride-to-be helps police chase down suspect who stole car, her gown days before wedding
item.description: A couple nearly had their wedding plans derailed when their car was stolen with the bride-to-be's wedding gown inside.

item.title: Farmer’s Market Sunday Forecast
item.description: Thunderstorm activity will pick up Sunday and Labor Day. Morning thunderstorms are likely both days

item.title: Nearly 3 million attic fans recalled for potential fire risk
item.description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission is recalling almost 3 million ceiling fans due to their potential to short circuit and start a fire.

item.title: Beach & Boating Forecast Sunday
item.description: Widespread storms develop on Sunday, especially in the morning

item.title: Handmade cards from classmates comfort girl wounded in church shooting, aunt says
item.description: Genevieve was one of the 20 people who were shot during the attack at the Church of Annunciation.

item.title: More thunderstorms Sunday and Monday
item.description: Thunderstorm activity will pick up on Sunday
